website_summaries.verdict: Mountaineering in the Scarpa Fuego means walking over rugged terrain in an outstandingly comfortable and ankle-supportive boot. It’s an impressively durable and versatile piece of climbing gear. Unfortunately, not everyone would appreciate this boot outright as reports concerning its ultra-stiff construction and long break-in period might be enough to turn them away. All in all, if mountaineers can give the boot enough time to loosen up, they would eventually discover how magnificently well-made the Scarpa Fuego really is.
pros: Many purchasers swore by the Scarpa Fuego’s tanklike durability
Dozens of wearers loved the boot for being quite the versatile footgear
The Fuego was praised by scores of owners for its majestic comfort
This Scarpa footwear quelled the worries of numerous users with its supportive ankle shaft
A decent percentage of Fuego reviewers only had great things to say about the boot and its remarkable lightness
Several mountaineers never lost their footing on uneven terrain in their Fuegos, and they couldn’t be any happier
Less than a handful of buyers admitted that their purchase of the boot was a wise investment
The Scarpa Fuego became an instant hit to a small number of owners thanks to its excellent stability
cons: Reviewers by the dozen were annoyed by the boot’s unyielding stiffness
Many users got extremely disappointed with the Scarpa Fuego’s long break-in period
About a handful of Scarpa fans detested the boot’s default insole for lacking enough cushioning

customer_reviews.title: Cracks x3. Never again.
customer_reviews.text: Have had 3 pairs of these boots. All have developed cracks in the shanks. This leads to the Vibram sole splitting over time. I work in fire, on a hotshot crew, and put these boots to the test. They unfortunately fail that test. This latest pair lasted around two months on the job. Boot cracked yesterday and now has no support at the heel. I'd expect much more from a $400 pair of boots.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality boot
customer_reviews.text: I use them for my fire station boots, works well in the snow cold weather , not the best for long hill hikes with no arch support but overall a good boot worth the money vs whites smoke jumper for a station fire boot. Whites hand down best still for the Fire line work boot l.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew e adams 707

customer_reviews.title: Longer breakin, but absolutely the best boots I’ve ever owned!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best boots I’ve ever worn. They are fantastic for ankle support, and are wonderful for the fire line as well. I’ll wear them in cold weather for hiking, fighting fire, hunting and anything else I may need them for. Super comfortable, robust, and stylish.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Brite

customer_reviews.title: These are my second pair of Fuego boots. My ...
customer_reviews.text: These are my second pair of Fuego boots. My first pair have lasted three years in wildland fire (on handcrew) and still have life left. I will never go back to traditional fire boots. My feet, knees and back hurt so much less at the day with these boots vs. traditional boots. Only complaint is they do make your feet sweat a lot and they do have a long break in period. They are well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Wore this boot for about 120 days last fall and winter pulled them out this fall and the soles cracked all the way through to the foot bed. For the price they weren’t worth 3 dollars a day to wear. Would not recommend purchasing to anyone. Also noted that I used them for light duty work and cold weather days no backcountry whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Aware

customer_reviews.title: so I did and they fit great. A very stiff boot
customer_reviews.text: The reviews I read said to order 1 size bigger, so I did and they fit great. A very stiff boot. I couldn't drive with them on at first because I couldn't bend my ankle. At first you walk like Frankenstein, they definitely have to be broken in.
customer_reviews.author: connie

customer_reviews.title: Read first
customer_reviews.text: Fits ok , but can feel the sides of the boots near the toes while going down hill, but overall comfortable Up hill and flat ground.It would've been nice if they had EE or wider
customer_reviews.author: F.Dvs

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable! Fit was spot on
customer_reviews.text: Worn them on my first fire this week. Very comfortable! Fit was spot on. Love these boots so far.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Runs very small
customer_reviews.text: These were the same size as all the other boots I own, could barely get my foot into them.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: ... of a new boot sole from REI boot was comfortable and fit well
customer_reviews.text: Maybe a little big but with the addition of a new boot sole from REI boot was comfortable and fit well. The boot is still and will take some time to break in but wore them on a fire already and did not have any issues other than being stiff. Great boot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Actually these were for my brother-in-law, he is a ...
customer_reviews.text: Actually these were for my brother-in-law, he is a fire fighter and others had these boots so he wanted to give them a try. He really likes them and has had no problems with them, even when fighting a fire.
customer_reviews.author: CLARK BENSON

customer_reviews.title: Durable and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: 2nd pair I’ve had. The fit is as expected and durability is very good. I use them on wild land fire. Never had any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Ed From Morehead

customer_reviews.title: Quality Boot
customer_reviews.text: They fit well. Have yet to get out with them. They are stiff, but I'm expecting that they will break in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great boots for wildland firefighting. Very stiff and takes time to break in, but are still comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Hastings

customer_reviews.title: Best money ever spent on boots
customer_reviews.text: Best money ever spent on boots. If you need ankle support this is the boot for you. Takes a little break in time.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: They are a touch big but with a pair of insoles they should be fine. Other then that I am loving them so ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair that I've tried, started with 42, then 42.5 and now 43. They are a touch big but with a pair of insoles they should be fine. Other then that I am loving them so far. I wore hawthorn loggers for fire seasons so I'm interested to see how these compare. Great boot so far thou!
customer_reviews.author: Travis F.

customer_reviews.title: Great boots.
customer_reviews.text: Used for firefighting. Held up perfectly. Pretty stiff initially but once broken in they were perfect.
customer_reviews.author: matteo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: If you need serious traction and don't mind a little extra warm toes buy these.
customer_reviews.author: BigFire

customer_reviews.title: Awesome boot
customer_reviews.text: Season of firefighting from Idaho to Texas n gilas.. Man there holding up.. Comfy the first week to break in.. Awesome
customer_reviews.author: Cory Chavez

customer_reviews.title: to all wildland firefighters
customer_reviews.text: This is the most comfortable boot ive come across. If your a wildland firefighter get this one its comfortable,light and looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Prins

customer_reviews.title: long time to break in
customer_reviews.text: These boot are great. I use them for wildlind fire fighting. They are light weight and sturdy. I must say however. Be prepared for a long break in time. They feel much like ski boots out of the box. Just be patient with these boot. It took me one full fire season to break them in but now I couldn't imagine wearing a different boot.
customer_reviews.author: cody

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: very comfortable. I work outdoors and on my feet all day. Great boot
customer_reviews.author: Aiyana

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Can't wait for fire season to prove these boots. They definitely need break-in time at first.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Size review, after 1 week of use.
customer_reviews.text: The toe has more room then I was expecting. The sides and ankle have the perfect snuggest I want in a pair of fire boots. 45 is a good conversion from 11.5.
customer_reviews.author: Blake Huff

customer_reviews.title: good boot
customer_reviews.text: Stiff, snug in the heal and just before the toes. Just right with plenty of toe wiggle and no foot slide. Good boot.
customer_reviews.author: james klungness-mshoi

customer_reviews.title: Great fire boot
customer_reviews.text: -My preferred boot for wildland fire -I've experienced no de-lamination with my previous Scarpa Mantas -Very stiff (much more so than La Sportiva Glacier or Cosmas) -Most durable boot I've used (Past Scarpa Mantis model which is very similar) -I've also spent a lot of time in Nick's Hotshots, La Sportiva Glacier, Cosmas Herules
customer_reviews.author: Jasper Blakk

customer_reviews.title: These boots have been great so far for firefighting as well as in the ...
customer_reviews.text: These boots have been great so far for firefighting as well as in the office. Using Obenauf's boot oil heavily on them and wearing them around the office for two weeks they broke in great. The sole is a little slippery on vinyl surfaces when wet. In the field I really like them as they wear like a hunting boot. They do not bite into a sidehill such as a White Logger boot, but they do feel a lot more comfortable for long periods of time. These are now my go to boot for work, and couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Rob S.

customer_reviews.title: tight is nice :)
customer_reviews.text: i wear a 10 to 10.5 wide depending on the maker. this is a first time scarpa buy for me so i followed advice from the web and ordered a 1/2 size larger since these were a medium width. the boot is tight but not squeezing my foot, feels great. i got them just for playing with my crampons on the ice and not for a lot of hiking so i will be wearing thicker socks with them and don't expect any trouble judging by the way they fit with medium weight wool socks and walking around the woods here at home so far. now, let the ice games begin.
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: Very long and very narrow compared to other Scarpa boots
customer_reviews.text: Very long and very narrow compared to other Scarpa boots I've tried. Mont Blanc in the same size fits me well, your mileage may vary!
customer_reviews.author: S. EckertTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Buy Whites or Sportivas
customer_reviews.text: Very hard to wear on the fireline. The soles are far too stiff for comfort.
customer_reviews.author: JP

product_meta.title: Scarpa Unisex-Adult Fuego-U Fuego-u
product_meta.description: Innovation and tradition share equally deep roots at SCARPA, a muti-generational, family-owned business whose headquarters and manufacturing facilities are in the same region of northern Italy where it was founded in 1938. SCARPA builds performance footwear for climbing, hiking, skiing, mountaineering, trail-running and other outdoor pursuits. Aside from being the Italian word for "shoe," SCARPA is an acronym for Societa Calzaturiera Asolana Riunita Pedemontana Anonima (Associated Shoe Manufacturing Company of the Asolo Mountain Area). The Scarpa Fuego is A no-nonsense boot without any of the unnecessary bells or whistles that's willing to go anywhere that you can get to.
feature_bullets: Double tongue for an excellent fit.
Ideal construction with tall cuff for foresters and wildland firefighters.
